altTitles.th: อิกโคคุ บ้านพักหรรษา

description.en:
(from ebookjapan):

Despite the obstacles thrown in his way by the residents, who are all crooked, the brave Godai is single-mindedly devoted to the new caretaker, Kyoko Otonashi. 

However, there is a huge and steep obstacle that stands in the way of his love for Kyoko. Kyoko is a widow whose husband died after six months of marriage... 

This immortal masterpiece is now available again in a new edition!


---
Official Release:
- English release by [Viz Media](https://www.viz.com/maison-ikkoku)
- Indonesian release by Elex Media

biography.en: Rumiko Takahashi (高橋 留美子, Takahashi Rumiko, born October 10, 1957) is a Japanese manga artist. With a career of several commercially successful works, beginning with Urusei Yatsura in 1978, Takahashi is one of Japan's best-known and wealthiest manga artists. Her works are popular worldwide, where they have been translated into a variety of languages, with over 200 million copies in circulation. She has won the Shogakukan Manga Award twice, once in 1980 for Urusei Yatsura and again in 2001 for Inuyasha, and the Seiun Award twice, once in 1987 for Urusei Yatsura and again in 1989 for Mermaid Saga. She also received the Grand Prix de la ville d'Angoulême in 2019, becoming the second woman and second Japanese to win the prize. In 2020, the Japanese government awarded Takahashi the Medal with Purple Ribbon for her contributions to the arts.
